Description: Handle from lid of Chian, probably black-figured, Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; white slip; exterior: glazed black on handle; plastic female head (facial features lost); dotted hem on veil and beaded necklace.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leipzig, Institut für Klassische Archäologie und Antikenmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd was lost in WWII. there is no evidence of black figure-related incision on the sherd. Lemos identifies the handle as the leg of a vase.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 317, no. 1390, pl. 178, no. 1390)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2087) (phase 2)
